metadata.name: Suspicious Invoke-Item From Mount-DiskImage
metadata.comment: Adversaries may abuse container files such as disk image (.iso, .vhd) file formats to deliver malicious payloads that may not be tagged with MOTW.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('mount-diskimage ')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-imagepath ')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('get-volume')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('.driveletter')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('invoke-item ')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('):\\')))

output.summary: Adversaries may abuse container files such as disk image (.iso, .vhd) file formats to deliver malicious payloads that may not be tagged with MOTW.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate PowerShell scripts References: https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/f339e7da7d05f6057fdfcdd3742bfcf365fee2a9/atomics/T1553.005/T1553.005.md#atomic-test-2---mount-an-iso-image-and-run-executable-from-the-iso, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/storage/mount-diskimage?view=windowsserver2022-ps
